category.term: 613~The Hunger Games~Taylor Swift~The Decemberists~The Civil Wars
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
If the Hunger Games were, say, a competition for baking hearty-and-delicious, gut-stuffing pastries -- and we really wish they were -- Taylor Swift would be a killer.

They're not, though. (Sorry, fat kids.) They're a brutal, fight-to-the death tournament of bloodsport. As such, our money's still on Katniss. Sorry, Swifty.

Still, we're happy to hear Swift providing some musical accompaniment to all the Hunger Games’ post-apocalyptic ultra-violence, and the double Grammy-winner debuted her video for "Safe & Sound" Monday night on MTV -- the lead video from the Hunger Games soundtrack (expected March 20), and a tune featuring back-up from her fellow Grammy-winners, country duo the Civil Wars.

Curiously, the clip doesn't feature any footage from the anticipated fantasy flick -- though Swift does discover a Mockingjay pin at one point in the video, a token worn by Hunger Games heroine Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence). She also comes across an adorable deer in a woodland glen (which she doesn't bother hunting for food -- a fatal moment of indecision for someone clearly playing a starving waif from District 12).

But really, when it comes to action in this music video, Swift's not seeing much of it. Wanly singing her Hunger Games lullaby, the country star wanders barefoot through a bleak wood, risking little more than pneumonia and maybe a tetanus shot.

"It was so cold. It was freezing. I was shaking the whole time and trying not to be shaking when the cameras were rolling," Swift told MTV of the video shoot, which took place on a muddy, 4 degrees Celsius day in Nashville. "It had just rained," she continued. "I'm wearing this 1920s vintage nightgown that didn't provide much warmth. I didn't get sick. I thought I was going to get sick. That was the upside."

Swift's video for "Safe & Sound" is posted below, but the Philip Andelman-directed piece is just one item in a veritable cornucopia of Hunger Games soundtrack intel being released. Grammy nominees The Decemberists recently shared their contribution to the compilation, "One Engine," (also posted below), and the record's complete tracklisting was also announced -- revealing a roster of artists including Neko Case, Miranda Lambert, Kid Cudi, Birdy, The Swell Season's Glen Hansard and -- in a slightly revelatory development -- the Arcade Fire.

There had already been reports that the Montreal band's Win Butler and Regine Chassagne would somehow contribute to the soundtrack. As Pitchfork noted earlier this year, the duo was expected to provide an orchestral piece called "Horn of Plenty."

Instead, we'll be hearing from the full band on a song called "Abraham's Daughter" -- which, Exclaim notes, was recorded just last week. Listen for it during the movie's final credits. As for "Horn of Plenty," Exclaim reports it'll still be heard -- albeit in a second Hunger Games soundtrack.

Full tracklisting for The Hunger Games: Songs From District 12 and Beyond posted below:

1. Taylor Swift (Feat. The Civil Wars) – “Safe & Sound”

2. Taylor Swift – “Eyes Wide Open”

3. Arcade Fire – “Abraham’s Daughter”

4. Kid Cudi – “The Ruler & The Killer”

5. Miranda Lambert (Feat. Pistol Annies) – “Run Daddy Run”

6. The Civil Wars – “Kingdom Come”

7. The Decemberists – “One Engine”

8. Glen Hansard – “Take the Heartland”

9. The Low Anthem – “Lover is Childlike”

10. Punch Brothers – “Dark Days”

11. Secret Sisters – “Tomorrow Will Be Kinder”

12. Birdy – “Just a Game”

13. Ella Mae Bowen – “Oh Come & Sing”

14. Jayme Dee – “Rules”

15. Carolina Chocolate Drops – “Reaping Day”

16. Neko Case – “Give Me Something I’ll Remember”

Watch Taylor Swift's video for "Safe & Sound":

Listen to The Decemberists' "One Engine":

One Engine by The Decemberists by mar-in-kinsey

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift always looks surprised in photos. But here's some news that really deserves an OMG-face: Swift was forced to cancel a series of concert dates due to bronchitis. Yikes! Get well soon, Swifty. It's time you built up your strength. Here, have a sandwich. In fact, have 10. We hope Swift's feeling better in time for her July 14 show in Montreal.
link.title: Gallery: Eat a Sandwich, Taylor Swift

entry.title: Adele Making Comeback at BRIT Awards; Will She Be Well Enough for a Grammy Gig, Too?

link.Abstract: Adele will play the BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, buoying hopes that the "Someone Like You" singer might also perform at the Grammy Awards Feb. 12.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Adele is confirmed to play the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21. Here she is at last year's show, shortly before her performance of "Someone Like You" caused a tsunami made of mascara and tears.
link.title: Adele BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift, Nicki Minaj, Kelly Clarkson and the Foo Fighters are among the first acts confirmed to play the 54th Annual Grammy Awards February 12. Check out who else is booked for music's big night.
link.title: Look Who's Playing the Grammy Awards

link.Abstract: Adele's tour rider leaked and it's outrageous -- for all the right reasons. A lot of pop stars are way more demanding. We've compiled some of the more infamous examples.
link.title: Outrageous Tour Riders

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West, Adele Lead Grammy Nominations

link.Abstract: Arcade Fire and Justin Bieber repped for Canada at the 2011 BRITs. The gong fest airs on MuchMusic Wednesday, Feb. 16 at 8 p.m. ET, but we've already got pictures from the show.
link.title: Photos: 2011 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: The VMAs are about fun -- the sort of fun that, this year at least, involves drag and distended wombs and at least a little swapping of spit. Here are a few of Sunday night’s best (and worst) examples.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments at the 2011 MTV VMAs

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, Mary J. Blige and more "celebrated soul" during the VH1 Divas special Dec. 18 in New York. We've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson and More are VH1 Divas

link.Abstract: Harry Potter's Rupert Grint stars in a new video from English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It's called "Lego House." Watch it here.
link.title: Harry Potter Star Rupert Grint's Latest Role? This Music Video

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine covered Drake's "Take Care" during an appearance at BBC 1's Live Lounge. Hear it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Take On Drake's 'Take Care'

link.Abstract: We're thrilled Chris Martin never made good on his promise to retire at 33. Here's why.
link.title: 10 Reasons To Be a Coldplay Fan

link.Abstract: Noel Gallagher took the stage in Toronto Nov. 7 for his first North American show as Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds -- or, rather, his first North American show not as a member of Oasis. Dose.ca was there.
link.title: Concert Review: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds at Massey Hall

link.Abstract: Run, Florence, run! There's a supernatural hit on Florence + The Machine in new video "No Light, No Light." Watch it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Dabble in Dark Arts For 'No Light, No Light' Clip
